Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
GuiController manages the visual representation of the Tetris game. It handles the game board, bricks (active and ghost pieces), timer, score display, next block preview, pause functionality, and game over screen.

This controller communicates with an InputEventListener to handle game logic while maintaining the user interface in sync with the underlying board state.

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game board view, creating rectangles for the grid, active brick, and ghost brick.

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)

      eventListener - the InputEventListener to handle user and thread events

    • showNextBlock

      public void showNextBlock(NextShapeInfo next)
      Renders a preview of the next block, scaling and centering it inside the preview panel.
      Parameters:
      next - shape and color data of the next piece

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Fully restarts the game from the game over menu. Resets timers, boards, state, and creates a new game session.

    • clearGhostPiece

      public void clearGhostPiece()
      Removes all previously drawn ghost piece rectangles from the grid.

    • drawGhostPiece

      public void drawGhostPiece(int[][] ghostData)
      Draws the ghost piece using semi-transparent rectangles to show where the active brick will land.
      Parameters:
      ghostData - 5x? array containing shape and final landing coordinates
